intro: Ageratum, commonly known as flossflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 36 inches and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers come in shades of white, purple, pink, and blue. Ageratum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
